p: Zika virus (ZIKV) is a flavivirus primarily spread by A. aegypti mosquitoes and causes a range of symptoms, including fever, joint pain, and headaches [ 1]. In addition, vertical (mother-to-fetus) transmission of the virus may result in microcephaly and other birth defects [ 2]. There is currently no available licensed vaccine, and most vaccine strategies directly target components of the virus.
